description:
As a developer
  I want to login to my user account
  So that I can authenticate and access protected functionality

steps.name: RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "test-registry" configured at "http://localhost:8080"
"test-registry" is the active registry
I attempt to login interactively
I should see "Logging in to http://localhost:8080"
I should see "Username:"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a clean config file with no registries
I login with username "testuser" and password "password123"
I should see "no active registry configured"
I should see "Use 'rfh registry add' to add one"

elements.name: Login when active registry not found

steps.name: RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a config with current registry "missing-registry"
I login with username "testuser" and password "password123"
I should see "active registry 'missing-registry' not found"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I run "rfh auth login --help"
I should see "Login to your user account with username and password"
I should see "Your JWT token will be saved locally for future API calls"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I run "rfh auth --help"
I should see "login       Login to your user account"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "offline-registry" configured at "http://localhost:9999"
"offline-registry" is the active registry
I login with username "testuser" and password "password123"
I should see "Logging in to http://localhost:9999"

elements.name: Successful non-interactive login with valid credentials

steps.name: RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "test-registry" configured at "http://localhost:8080"
"test-registry" is the active registry
I login with username "validuser" and password "validpass"
I should see "Using provided credentials for validuser"
I should see "Logging in to http://localhost:8080"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "test-registry" configured at "http://localhost:8080"
"test-registry" is the active registry
I login with username "invaliduser" and password "wrongpass"
I should see "Using provided credentials for invaliduser"
I should see "login failed"

name: User Login

description:
As a developer
  I want to register a new user account
  So that I can authenticate and publish packages

steps.name: RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "test-registry" configured at "http://localhost:8080"
"test-registry" is the active registry
I attempt to register interactively
I should see "Registering new account at http://localhost:8080"
I should see "Username:"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a clean config file with no registries
I register with username "testuser", email "test@example.com", and password "password123"
I should see "no active registry configured"
I should see "Use 'rfh registry add' to add one"

elements.name: Registration when active registry not found

steps.name: RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a config with current registry "missing-registry"
I register with username "testuser", email "test@example.com", and password "password123"
I should see "active registry 'missing-registry' not found"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I run "rfh auth register --help"
I should see "Register a new user account with username, email, and password"
I should see "After successful registration, you'll be automatically logged in"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I run "rfh auth --help"
I should see "Authentication commands"
I should see "register    Register a new user account"
I should see "login       Login to your user account"
I should see "logout      Logout from your user account"
I should see "whoami      Show current user information"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "test-registry" configured at "http://localhost:8080"
"test-registry" is the active registry
I register with username "newuser", email "newuser@example.com", and password "password123" using flags
I should see "Using provided credentials for newuser"
I should see "Registering new account at http://localhost:8080"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "test-registry" configured at "http://localhost:8080"
"test-registry" is the active registry
I register with username "testuser", email "test@domain.com", and password "securepass" using flags
I should see "Using provided credentials for testuser (test@domain.com)"
I should see "Registering new account at http://localhost:8080"

name: User Registration Command

description:
As a developer
  I want to initialize a new RuleStack project in an empty directory
  So that I can start creating and managing rule packages

steps.name: I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
I run "rfh init"
I should see "Initialized RuleStack project"
a file "rulestack.json" should be created
the default package name should be "example-rules"
a directory ".rulestack" should be created
a file "CLAUDE.md" should be created
core rules should be downloaded to ".rulestack/core.v1.0.0"
I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
I run "rfh init"
the "rulestack.json" file should be valid JSON
the manifest should contain:
the manifest should have the following structure:
I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
I run "rfh init"
the following files and directories should exist:
I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
I run "rfh init --help"
I should see "force"
I should see "help"
I should not see "name"
I should not see "migrate"
I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
I run "rfh init"
I should see output containing:

name: Initialize RFH project in empty directory

description:
As a developer
  I want to understand how RFH init behaves with existing files
  So that I can work with existing projects correctly

elements.name: Initialize in directory with existing rulestack.json

steps.name: I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
a file "rulestack.json" already exists
I run "rfh init"
I should see "RuleStack project already initialized"
I should see "Use --force to reinitialize"
the existing "rulestack.json" should not be overwritten
I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
a file "rulestack.json" already exists
I run "rfh init --force"
I should see "Initialized RuleStack project"
the manifest should have name "example-rules"
a file "CLAUDE.md" should be created
a directory ".rulestack" should be created
I am in an empty directory
RFH is installed and accessible
a file "CLAUDE.md" already exists
I run "rfh init"
I should see "Initialized RuleStack project"
a file "rulestack.json" should be created
a directory ".rulestack" should be created

name: Initialize RFH project with existing files

description:
As a developer
  I want to manage multiple registry configurations
  So that I can work with different package repositories

steps.name: RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I run "rfh registry add production https://registry.example.com"
I should see "Added registry 'production'"
I should see "Set as active registry"
I should see "Use 'rfh auth login' to authenticate"
the config should contain registry "production" with URL "https://registry.example.com"
"production" should be the current active registry
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I run "rfh registry add staging https://staging.example.com"
I should see "Added registry 'staging'"
the config should contain both registries
"production" should remain the active registry
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I run "rfh registry list"
I should see "No registries configured"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I run "rfh registry list"
I should see "production" in the registry list
I should see "https://registry.example.com" in the registry list
I should see "production" marked as active
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
"staging" is the active registry
I run "rfh registry list"
I should see both registries in the list
I should see "staging" marked as active
I should not see "production" marked as active
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
"production" is the active registry
I run "rfh registry use staging"
I should see "Set 'staging' as active registry"
"staging" should be the current active registry
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
"staging" is the active registry
I run "rfh registry remove production"
I should see "Removed registry 'production'"
"staging" should remain the active registry
the config should not contain registry "production"
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I have a registry "staging" configured at "https://staging.example.com"
"staging" is the active registry
I run "rfh registry remove staging"
I should see "Removed active registry"
I should see a warning about setting a new active registry
no registry should be active
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I run "rfh registry use nonexistent"
I should see an error about registry not found
the command should exit with non-zero status
RFH is installed and accessible
I have a clean config file
I have a registry "production" configured at "https://registry.example.com"
I run "rfh registry add production https://different.example.com"
I should see "Added registry 'production'"
the config should contain registry "production" with URL "https://different.example.com"

name: Registry Management
